assembly.label: Genome assembly
assembly.description: The genome assembly. Can be a string for an available assembly (mm9, hg19, hg38, etc) or the path of an hdf5 file containing genomic information (see alabtools.Genome objects)

ploidy.label: Ploidy
ploidy.description: This parameter controls the number of copies for each chromosome. Valid values are `haploid`, `diploid`, `male` (two copies for each autosome, one X and one Y), or a dictionary of chromosome, number of copies pairs. The character `#` is a shortcut for autosomes. Es: {"#" : 4, "X" : 3, "Y": 2} will create a model with 4 copies for each autosome, 3 copies for X, 2 copies for Y

usechr.label: Chromosomes considered
usechr.description: A list of chromosomes used in the modeling. The character `#` is a shortcut for autosomes. Can be strings or a genome

segmentation.label: Genome segmentation
segmentation.description: The genome segmentation. Each segment will be represented by one bead. Can be a bed file or an hdf5 file containing a genomic index. If the genome assembly is specified and recognized, it can also be an integer number of basepairs N: in this case, the genome will be split in regions os size N.

population_size.label: Number of structures
population_size.description: Number of structures in the population

starting_coordinates.label: Initial coordinates
starting_coordinates.description: An hss file with the starting coordinates. If not specified, a random polymer model with territories will be generated as a starting point

occupancy.label: Volume occupancy
occupancy.description: Fraction of volume occupied by the hard core of the beads

evfactor.label: Scale factor for excluded volume
evfactor.description: Scale excluded volume interactions. Smaller values correspond to weaker interactions

nucleus_kspring.label: Nucleus shape restraint force constant
nucleus_kspring.description: The force constant for nucleus shape

contact_range.label: Contact range
contact_range.description: Two beads are considered in contact when their distance is `contact_range` times the sum of their hard-core radiuses

polymer_bonds_style.label: Polymer bond style
polymer_bonds_style.description: The polymeric bond style to apply. If set to `simple` (the default), successive beads in a chromosome are restrained to be closer than the `contact_range` distance. If set to `hic`, it will use Hi-C information to set distances accordingly to the probability values. If set to `none`, successive bead contacts are not imposed

polymer_kspring.label: polymeric bond restraint force constant
polymer_kspring.description: The force constant for polymeric bond

input_matrix.label: Input probability matrix
input_matrix.description: A .hcs file containing the input pairwise probability matrix

sigma_list.label: Sigma probabilities
sigma_list.description: The list of decreasing cutoff probabilities for iterative optimization of Hi-C contacts

contact_range.label: Contact range
contact_range.description: Two beads are considered in contact when their distance is `contact_range` times the sum of their hard-core radiuses

contact_kspring.label: Hi-C restraint force constant
contact_kspring.description: The force constant for Hi-C restraints [F=-k(x - x0, where x is the distance, x0 the contact distance, and k the force constant]

actdist_file.label: Activation distances file
actdist_file.description: A hdf5 file where to store information on the activation distances for Hi-C restraints

run_evaluation_step.label: Run evaluation step
run_evaluation_step.description: Run a detailed evaluation step after every modeling cycle

input_profile.label: Input damid profile
input_profile.description: A text file with the input damid profile

sigma_list.label: Sigma probabilities
sigma_list.description: The list of decreasing cutoff probabilities for iterative optimization of envelope contacts

contact_range.label: Contact range
contact_range.description: A bead is considered in contact with the envelope when the center to envelope distance is `contact_range` times its hard-core radius

contact_kspring.label: DamID restraint force constant
contact_kspring.description: The force constant for DamID restraints [F=-k(x - x0, where x is the distance, x0 the contact distance, and k the force constant]

damid_actdist_file.label: DamID activation distances file
damid_actdist_file.description: A hdf5 file where to store information on the activation distances for DamID restraints

clusters.label: Cluster file
clusters.description: A hdf5 file containing the data for sprite clusters

volume_fraction.label: Volume fraction
volume_fraction.description: Target occupied volume fraction by each sprite cluster

contact_range.label: Contact range
contact_range.description: Two beads are considered in contact when their distance is `contact_range` times the sum of their hard-core radiuses

kspring.label: Sprite restraint force constant
kspring.description: The force constant for Sprite restraints [F=-k(x - x0), where x is the distance, x0 the target distance, and k the force constant]

radius_kt.label: Gyration radius temperature parameter for assignment
radius_kt.description: The assignment procedure is a stochastic process depending on a Gibbs weight. The weight includes the radius of gyration of the cluster and the number of already assigned clusters. The `radius_kt` parameter controls the importance and flexibility of the radius of gyration value in the assignment. Two structures with a difference in cluster gyration radius of `radius_kt` are assigned a difference of 1KT

assignment_file.label: Sprite assignment file
assignment_file.description: A hdf5 file where to store information on the aassignment of sprite restraints

max_chrom_in_cluster.label: Maximum number of chromosomes in a cluster
max_chrom_in_cluster.description: Ignore clusters with more than `max_chrom_in_cluster` chromosomes

batch_size.label: Batch size
batch_size.description: Cluster are analyzed in batches of size `batch_size`

keep_best.label: Best structures pool
keep_best.description: Each cluster will be assigned to one structure in a pool of best fit structures. This parameter controls the size of the pool. Cannot be larger than the number of structures. Keep in mind that making this number larger has a (mainly I/O) performance impact

fish_file.label: FISH restraints file
fish_file.description: A hdf5 file of input FISH distance distributions

rtype.label: FISH restraints type
rtype.description: The FISH restraint types to impose, as a combination of characters `r`, `R`, `p` and `P`. `r`: minimum radial; `R`: maximum radial; `p`: minimum pairs; `P`: maximum pairs

kspring.label: FISH restraints force constant
kspring.description: The force constant for FISH restraints [F=-k(x - x0), where x is the distance, x0 the target distance, and k the force constant]

tolerance_list.label: FISH tolerances
tolerance_list.description: Decreasing tolerances list for fish restraints

min_iterations.label: Minimum optimization iterations
min_iterations.description: Minimum number of optimization iterations. The 0th iteration is special: if it succeeds, the pipeline skips to the next step ignoring this parameter.

force_last_iteration.label: Force minimum iterations before end
force_last_iteration.description: Ensure that at least min_iterations are performed before finishing the pipeline.

max_iterations.label: Max optimization iterations
max_iterations.description: Maximum number of unsuccessful optimization iterations before giving up

violation_tolerance.label: Violation tolerance
violation_tolerance.description: Distance tolerance before flagging a restraint as violated

max_violations.label: Max number of violations
max_violations.description: Fraction of allowed restraint violations on the total number of imposed restraints. Note that excluded volume is not considered in this computation.

structure_output.label: Output file name
structure_output.description: File name of the output model file (hss format)

keep_intermediate_structures.label: Keep Intermediate Structures
keep_intermediate_structures.description: Keep a copy of the population for each optimization iteration

kernel.label: Optimization Kernel
kernel.description: The MD software used for minimization.

lammps_executable.label: LAMMPS executable
lammps_executable.description: The custom LAMMPS executable. Needs to be accessible by the workers

seed.label: Random seed
seed.description: Random seed for optimization, specify to have binary repetible MD runs

max_neigh.label: Maximum number of neighbors
max_neigh.description: Specify the maximum number of neighbors for lammps particles. Larger numbers impact memory usage, but may be necessary if the structures are very uneven.

use_gpu.label: Use GPU
use_gpu.description: Use gpu options for pair potential

mdsteps.label: Number of MD steps
mdsteps.description: Number of MD steps for each round of optimization

max_velocity.label: Cap bead velocity
max_velocity.description: In presence of extremely large forces, the velocity of beads will be capped to avoid explosion of the simulation

thermo.label: Dhermodynamic steps
thermo.description: Output thermodynamic info every <thermo> MD timesteps

step_db.label: Step database
step_db.description: SQLite database file containing execution history

controller.label: Controller type
controller.description: The type of controller used to map parallel jobs.

timeout.label: Max execution time
timeout.description: If specified, the maximum execution time per task (in seconds).

max_tasks.label: Maximum number of tasks per submission
max_tasks.description: If a positive number, limit the number of parallel tasks sent to the scheduler, mapping arguments in chunks if needed. A negative number sets no limit.

simultaneous_tasks.label: Maximum number of jobs submitted at the same time
simultaneous_tasks.description: Setting this number to a lower value than `max_tasks` will avoid flooding the queue and make Luigi very mad.

max_tasks.label: Maximum number of tasks per submission
max_tasks.description: If a positive number, limit the number of parallel tasks sent to the scheduler, mapping arguments in chunks if needed.

mem.label: Memory
mem.description: The memory requested for each job

walltime.label: Walltime
walltime.description: The maximum walltime for each job

template.label: Template
template.description: A custom template for the slurm submit script. Variables are indicated with {{variable_name}}

other_options.label: Other options
other_options.description: A json dictionary with additional variables to insert in the script
